title: Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist
description: [  Who We Are  7Geese is a fun, ambitious startup helping people to grow and achieve more in their work. Our platform encourages continuous feedback, coaching, peer recognition, and OKR goal setting. Established in 2012, we are a mature product in an emerging market, with over 300 customers worldwide, served by our small (but growing!) and diverse team in Vancouver, Canada. Our office is nestled in the heart of the bustling and historic Gastown. Why you should join us   Be heard: Our open management culture encourages you to make your voice heard and allows anyone to take charge of a project and team  Enjoy your work, enjoy your life: We offer all our employees competitive salaries, truly flexible work schedules, regular remote working, a generous flexible vacation policy, maternity / paternity leave and a comprehensive extended benefits plan.  A product to believe in: At 7Geese we use our own product on a daily basis. We use 7Geese to set team and personal goals, get feedback, and create career growth plans to maximize professional growth.  Never go hungry: Our kitchen is always stocked with snacks and drinks to keep that brain of yours fuelled and finely tuned.  Perpetual learning machine: We dedicate one week every quarter to learning new skills and technologies. We also host weekly lunch and learns. Free food and a show, what could be better?  Deploy small, deploy often: We use modern continuous integration and deployment processes, so our users benefit from your genius immediately   The Role   Research and implement new features related to data and machine learning. These might involve NLP, recommender systems, classification algorithms, or other techniques and tools  Improve and continue building out our data pipeline  Work closely with our product squads to uncover insights and data trends to inform new product development  Help our customer success team develop reports that make our customers more successful  Work with the leadership team to answer questions which allow our business to move forward   About you   You are a team player and welcome exposure to people at all levels and departments  You have a passion for technology, the desire to champion ideas and share your knowledge  You take pride in your work and have an appreciation for the user experience  You are receptive to feedback and are excited to learn and share with your awesome colleagues   Skills and qualifications   2+ years of industry experience  Experience with Python and some aspect of machine learning or data analysis  Ability to learn new technologies quickly  Comfortable working independently in a small team   Extra Credit   Experience with AWS  Do you contribute to open source projects or have a passion project? Tell us about it!   Not for you? Perhaps you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Share this with them. Thanks!   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Who We Are

7Geese is a fun, ambitious startup helping people to grow and achieve more in their work. Our platform encourages continuous feedback, coaching, peer recognition, and OKR goal setting. Established in 2012, we are a mature product in an emerging market, with over 300 customers worldwide, served by our small (but growing!) and diverse team in Vancouver, Canada. Our office is nestled in the heart of the bustling and historic Gastown. Why you should join us
  • Be heard: Our open management culture encourages you to make your voice heard and allows anyone to take charge of a project and team
  • Enjoy your work, enjoy your life: We offer all our employees competitive salaries, truly flexible work schedules, regular remote working, a generous flexible vacation policy, maternity / paternity leave and a comprehensive extended benefits plan.
  • A product to believe in: At 7Geese we use our own product on a daily basis. We use 7Geese to set team and personal goals, get feedback, and create career growth plans to maximize professional growth.
  • Never go hungry: Our kitchen is always stocked with snacks and drinks to keep that brain of yours fuelled and finely tuned.
  • Perpetual learning machine: We dedicate one week every quarter to learning new skills and technologies. We also host weekly lunch and learns. Free food and a show, what could be better?
  • Deploy small, deploy often: We use modern continuous integration and deployment processes, so our users benefit from your genius immediately
The Role
  • Research and implement new features related to data and machine learning. These might involve NLP, recommender systems, classification algorithms, or other techniques and tools
  • Improve and continue building out our data pipeline
  • Work closely with our product squads to uncover insights and data trends to inform new product development
  • Help our customer success team develop reports that make our customers more successful
  • Work with the leadership team to answer questions which allow our business to move forward
About you
  • You are a team player and welcome exposure to people at all levels and departments
  • You have a passion for technology, the desire to champion ideas and share your knowledge
  • You take pride in your work and have an appreciation for the user experience
  • You are receptive to feedback and are excited to learn and share with your awesome colleagues
Skills and qualifications
  • 2+ years of industry experience
  • Experience with Python and some aspect of machine learning or data analysis
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly
  • Comfortable working independently in a small team
Extra Credit
  • Experience with AWS
  • Do you contribute to open source projects or have a passion project? Tell us about it!
Not for you? Perhaps you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Share this with them. Thanks!

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareInternet
]

title: Data Analyst
description: [ Canada - British Columbia, Burnaby  Job Summary  The AECOM Asset Management team is actively seeking an Intermediate Data Analyst for immediate employment in its Burnaby, BC, office. The Data Analyst position will support the Asset Management Team in identifying, collecting, validating and transforming data with the purpose of allowing the team to utilize data driven decision making processes and reporting of metrics and dashboards for our projects and initiatives. In addition to a strong technical ability, you will have an innovative approach and ability to take on responsibility, communicate clearly and effectively, be organized and work collaboratively with other team members. This position is ideal for an individual who possesses an appropriate balance of both technical ability and people skills and will be assisting with the following  Overseeing the National Water, Wastewater and Transportation Benchmarking databases.  Working with the Asset Management Team to determine the data requirements for projects and identify the best practices for data collection and storage.  Extracting business requirements from clients by actively listening and comprehending complex information and identifying data to meet those requirements.  Developing, implementing and maintaining appropriate measurement plans to enable the collection data for the Asset Management Team and others as needed.  Collecting data manually as required.  Developing data collection systems and other strategies that optimize collection efficiency and data quality.  Proactively assessing the quality of the data captured.  Working closely with the Asset Management Team to prioritize data and information requests.  The Data Analyst’s responsibilities may include presenting data in charts, graphs, tables, and dashboards as well as designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.  Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.    Minimum Requirements   Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Economics, Engineering, Business, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field of study.  2+ years of experience with developing, implementing and maintaining a data collection system.  Ability to obtain data using ERP systems , interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, etc.  Experience utilizing data modeling / visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.  Strong analytical skills; ability to gather, analyze and synthesize information. Must work with large amounts of data, facts, figures and numbers.  Excellent Attention to Detail The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will help in creating valuable publications and metrics that will highlight AECOM’s projects and success of its policies, etc. Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.  Expert in MS Excel data analysis and data visualization tools. (pivot tables/charts, lookup tables)  Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into understandable written reports and verbal presentations.    Preferred Qualifications   Proficient in using MS Office Suite.  Ability to collaborate and work effectively across internal (inter-departmental) functions areas; including the ability to manage competing interests and communicate successfully in both direct and indirect reporting relationships.  Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality and to handle sensitive issues with tact and diplomacy.  Ability to manage multiple activities simultaneously and complete on schedule.    What We Offer  When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.  Job Category Engineering  Business Line Water  Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)  Country Canada  Position Status Full-Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. 224416BR  Clearance Required No Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.  Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering  Industries Architecture & Planning Civil Engineering Construction  ]
description_raw:
[
Canada - British Columbia, Burnaby

Job Summary

The AECOM Asset Management team is actively seeking an Intermediate Data Analyst for immediate employment in its Burnaby, BC, office. The Data Analyst position will support the Asset Management Team in identifying, collecting, validating and transforming data with the purpose of allowing the team to utilize data driven decision making processes and reporting of metrics and dashboards for our projects and initiatives. In addition to a strong technical ability, you will have an innovative approach and ability to take on responsibility, communicate clearly and effectively, be organized and work collaboratively with other team members. This position is ideal for an individual who possesses an appropriate balance of both technical ability and people skills and will be assisting with the following
  • Overseeing the National Water, Wastewater and Transportation Benchmarking databases.
  • Working with the Asset Management Team to determine the data requirements for projects and identify the best practices for data collection and storage.
  • Extracting business requirements from clients by actively listening and comprehending complex information and identifying data to meet those requirements.
  • Developing, implementing and maintaining appropriate measurement plans to enable the collection data for the Asset Management Team and others as needed.
  • Collecting data manually as required.
  • Developing data collection systems and other strategies that optimize collection efficiency and data quality.
  • Proactively assessing the quality of the data captured.
  • Working closely with the Asset Management Team to prioritize data and information requests.
  • The Data Analyst’s responsibilities may include presenting data in charts, graphs, tables, and dashboards as well as designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.
  • Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


Minimum Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Economics, Engineering, Business, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field of study.
  • 2+ years of experience with developing, implementing and maintaining a data collection system.
  • Ability to obtain data using ERP systems , interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, etc.
  • Experience utilizing data modeling / visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to gather, analyze and synthesize information. Must work with large amounts of data, facts, figures and numbers.
  • Excellent Attention to Detail The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will help in creating valuable publications and metrics that will highlight AECOM’s projects and success of its policies, etc. Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.
  • Expert in MS Excel data analysis and data visualization tools. (pivot tables/charts, lookup tables)
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into understandable written reports and verbal presentations.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Proficient in using MS Office Suite.
  • Ability to collaborate and work effectively across internal (inter-departmental) functions areas; including the ability to manage competing interests and communicate successfully in both direct and indirect reporting relationships.
  • Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality and to handle sensitive issues with tact and diplomacy.
  • Ability to manage multiple activities simultaneously and complete on schedule.


What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is

pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions

inclusion, diversity and overall

employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our

core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only

delivering a better world , but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Job Category Engineering

Business Line Water

Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)

Country Canada

Position Status Full-Time

Requisition/Vacancy No. 224416BR

Clearance Required No

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

  • Seniority level

    Mid-Senior level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Engineering

  • Industries

    Architecture & PlanningCivil EngineeringConstruction
]

title: Data Analyst
description: [  What’s the job?  Reporting to the Member Experience Intelligence Manager, the Member Experience Analyst is responsible for providing member insights to the organization that drive strategic actions related to evolving our member experience. You will suggest member experience improvements based on data analysis. The analyst will use a variety of analytical techniques and data sources including but not limited to Voice of Member surveys, Contact Center emails and phone call transcripts, social media interactions and operational data. Additionally, this role will be responsible for the configuration of our data sets, which could include data scrubbing and sample management.  What You’ll Get To Do   Responsible for tracking, trending and reporting member experience metrics that are derived from multiple data points. The analyst is responsible for creating and automating monthly reports and dashboards for tracking programs.  Development of topic and sentiment models for unstructured data  Conduct exploratory data analysis to generate hypotheses and identify patterns in member data.  Support in the development of a 360 degree view of the member that gathers, consolidates and produces actionable insights from all member facing data sources (i.e. combination of experience data and operational data)  Conduct detailed root-cause analysis and data mining around member concerns.  Select appropriate methods and tools to guide the completion of reporting requirements.  Provide actionable summaries of findings to other departments on a proactive basis.  Educate and raise awareness of the MX intelligence body within the organization.  Support with member experience analytics and reporting as required.  Who are we looking for?  2+ years of job related knowledge in customer experience analysis, reporting and dashboards.  Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Market Research, Operations Research, Economics of other quantitative discipline.  Experience with statistical programming software (i.e. SPSS, SAS etc.) and visualization software (i.e. Tableau).  Experience with unstructured data and use of text analytics and topic modelling techniques.  Moderate knowledge with databases including crosstab queries, modifying records in tables, importing/exporting objects, linking databases etc.  Top Skills Necessary  Advanced experience working with Excel formulas and spreadsheets (i.e. v-lookup, if statements, pivot tables, sort, charts, filters, graphs etc.).  Experience with statistical methodologies which, include: multivariate regression, correlation matrixes, conjoint analysis etc.   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
What’s the job?

Reporting to the Member Experience Intelligence Manager, the Member Experience Analyst is responsible for providing member insights to the organization that drive strategic actions related to evolving our member experience. You will suggest member experience improvements based on data analysis. The analyst will use a variety of analytical techniques and data sources including but not limited to Voice of Member surveys, Contact Center emails and phone call transcripts, social media interactions and operational data. Additionally, this role will be responsible for the configuration of our data sets, which could include data scrubbing and sample management.

What You’ll Get To Do
  • Responsible for tracking, trending and reporting member experience metrics that are derived from multiple data points. The analyst is responsible for creating and automating monthly reports and dashboards for tracking programs.
  • Development of topic and sentiment models for unstructured data
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to generate hypotheses and identify patterns in member data.
  • Support in the development of a 360 degree view of the member that gathers, consolidates and produces actionable insights from all member facing data sources (i.e. combination of experience data and operational data)
  • Conduct detailed root-cause analysis and data mining around member concerns.
  • Select appropriate methods and tools to guide the completion of reporting requirements.
  • Provide actionable summaries of findings to other departments on a proactive basis.
  • Educate and raise awareness of the MX intelligence body within the organization.
  • Support with member experience analytics and reporting as required.
Who are we looking for?
  • 2+ years of job related knowledge in customer experience analysis, reporting and dashboards.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Market Research, Operations Research, Economics of other quantitative discipline.
  • Experience with statistical programming software (i.e. SPSS, SAS etc.) and visualization software (i.e. Tableau).
  • Experience with unstructured data and use of text analytics and topic modelling techniques.
  • Moderate knowledge with databases including crosstab queries, modifying records in tables, importing/exporting objects, linking databases etc.
Top Skills Necessary
  • Advanced experience working with Excel formulas and spreadsheets (i.e. v-lookup, if statements, pivot tables, sort, charts, filters, graphs etc.).
  • Experience with statistical methodologies which, include: multivariate regression, correlation matrixes, conjoint analysis etc.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and Services
]

title: Data Analyst/Developer
description: [ On behalf of our enterprise client, Affinity is looking for an intermediate level data analyst with more than three years of Microsoft SQL Server to work on an information exchange project. Required work experience and skills needed to support analysis of the existing complex data structures, development of SQL statements for data extraction, implementing new tables, developing stored procedures, performance tuning and supporting implemented artifacts after go-live.  Required Skills And Experience   Practical knowledge of relational and dimensional data modeling;  Analysis and reverse-engineering of relational data structures;  Development of well-structured SQL statements for data extraction;  Implementation of relational database tables and views using Data Definition Language  Development of database stored procedures and functions for execution of data updates;  Performance tuning of the developed artifacts;  Ability to present concepts using diagrams and verbal communication.   Desired Skills   Experience of operating within a DevOps Software Development Life Cycle;  Practical experience with implementing batch data integration processes;  Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services;  Practical experience of work with issue tracking systems (e.g. JIRA);  Certifications from software vendors.   About Affinity  Affinity is a full service Information Technology agency that takes a unique approach to recruiting. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on four core principles – Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility. For more information on Affinity Staffing, please visit www.affinity-group.ca  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
On behalf of our enterprise client, Affinity is looking for an intermediate level data analyst with more than three years of Microsoft SQL Server to work on an information exchange project. Required work experience and skills needed to support analysis of the existing complex data structures, development of SQL statements for data extraction, implementing new tables, developing stored procedures, performance tuning and supporting implemented artifacts after go-live.

Required Skills And Experience
  • Practical knowledge of relational and dimensional data modeling;
  • Analysis and reverse-engineering of relational data structures;
  • Development of well-structured SQL statements for data extraction;
  • Implementation of relational database tables and views using Data Definition Language
  • Development of database stored procedures and functions for execution of data updates;
  • Performance tuning of the developed artifacts;
  • Ability to present concepts using diagrams and verbal communication.
Desired Skills
  • Experience of operating within a DevOps Software Development Life Cycle;
  • Practical experience with implementing batch data integration processes;
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services;
  • Practical experience of work with issue tracking systems (e.g. JIRA);
  • Certifications from software vendors.
About Affinity

Affinity is a full service Information Technology agency that takes a unique approach to recruiting. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on four core principles – Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility.

For more information on Affinity Staffing, please visit www.affinity-group.ca

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: [  Working Location: Singapore We’re Hiring Senior Data Scientist!  Agoda is a Booking Holdings (BKNG) company, the world’s leading provider of brands that help people book great experiences through technology. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What’s stopping you from getting in touch? We move fast – why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we’re on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot. Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there – and get your career going places, too. Maintaining this growth requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together.  Your Role Is To   Crack our business problems and come up with deployable machine learning models  Interface with business to make sure they are asking the right questions  Sift through our data and find us some gems  Be a world-class hands-on deploy master    Charm Us With   An earned stripes in coding, in data handling, in statistics and in machine learning (5 years of experience is a must)  Hands-on experiences and good understanding of various NLP techniques and topics (e.g. RNN, CNN, word embedding, seq2seq model, text generation, read comprehension, etc)  A good balance between theory and practice and a strong desire to learn and keep up with the latest technologies (an academic quantitative degree, preferably a PhD, earns more points)  A good knowledge of what’s “Under the hood” of statistical methods  Coding, coding, coding (R, Python, C#, Java, C++, Scala, …)  Some extra points on: SQL, NLP, business acumen, blog writing, good sense of humor  #singapore #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #denver #chicago #boston #newyork #portland #seattle #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #copenhagen #helsinki #dublin #munich #hongkong #budapest #tokyo #oslo #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #moscow #seoul #taipei #london #manchester #liverpool #hcmc #ENG #IT #4   Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology Engineering  Industries Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Working Location: Singapore

We’re Hiring Senior Data Scientist!

Agoda is a Booking Holdings (BKNG) company, the world’s leading provider of brands that help people book great experiences through technology. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What’s stopping you from getting in touch?

We move fast – why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we’re on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there – and get your career going places, too.

Maintaining this growth requires an incredible amount of data, a superior IT infrastructure, and world class talent to bring it all together.

Your Role Is To
  • Crack our business problems and come up with deployable machine learning models
  • Interface with business to make sure they are asking the right questions
  • Sift through our data and find us some gems
  • Be a world-class hands-on deploy master


Charm Us With
  • An earned stripes in coding, in data handling, in statistics and in machine learning (5 years of experience is a must)
  • Hands-on experiences and good understanding of various NLP techniques and topics (e.g. RNN, CNN, word embedding, seq2seq model, text generation, read comprehension, etc)
  • A good balance between theory and practice and a strong desire to learn and keep up with the latest technologies (an academic quantitative degree, preferably a PhD, earns more points)
  • A good knowledge of what’s “Under the hood” of statistical methods
  • Coding, coding, coding (R, Python, C#, Java, C++, Scala, …)
  • Some extra points on: SQL, NLP, business acumen, blog writing, good sense of humor

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: [  This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.  Part of Booking Holdings (BKNG), Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online travel platform in Asia. We are looking for ambitious data scientists that would like to take part in implementing cutting edge technologies on one of the largest and quickest moving data sets worldwide. We move fast, work on tough challenges, laugh and do that from one of the most exciting and vibrant places in the world today - Bangkok Thailand. Agodans come from over 70 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot of talents pin-picked from all corners of the planet. [
This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Part of Booking Holdings (BKNG), Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online travel platform in Asia. We are looking for ambitious data scientists that would like to take part in implementing cutting edge technologies on one of the largest and quickest moving data sets worldwide.

We move fast, work on tough challenges, laugh and do that from one of the most exciting and vibrant places in the world today - Bangkok Thailand.

Agodans come from over 70 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot of talents pin-picked from all corners of the planet.

On your day-to-day work you will change the way people run their lives and help our business to grow, improve and expand to new exciting domains. Your voice will be heard, and you will be able to make a difference in a business that touches millions of users in every hour of the day!

Responsibilities

How will your day look like?
  • Build state of the art models and algorithms to support operations and business decisions.
  • Mine our big data to find actionable insights to drive ongoing improvements and fertilize new discoveries.
  • Work with developers and business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality.
  • Discover, research and harness new ideas that can make a difference.


Qualifications

The Musts
  • Open-minded quick learner with desire to explore and keep up with the latest technologies.
  • 3+ years hands on experience as a data scientist / statistician / data engineer.
  • Hands on experience and understanding of ML/AI and related software libraries.
  • Hands on experience with Deep Learning frameworks like Keras, TF, PyTorch and/or others.
  • Excellent Proficiency in SQL and languages like Python and/or Scala.
  • Independent as well as great team player.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.

Great if you have them
  • MSc+ in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields (a PhD is a major plus).
  • Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems.
  • Hands on experience working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop.
  • Experience in data science for e-commerce.

[
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Overview

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Booking Holdings (BKNG) company, the world’s leading provider of brands that help people book great experiences through technology, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What’s stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it’s 30°+ outside, our engineers don’t sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast – why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we’re on the subject, Agoda people come from over 74 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there – and get your career going places, too.

Responsibilities
  • Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building a structured analysis, and rigorously evaluating methods and results
  • Provide analytical and valuable insights for decision-making support for key projects and management
  • Work closely with various business functions to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
  • Communicate findings and propose actionable recommendations to address the problems


Qualifications
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering
  • At least 3-years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
  • Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
  • Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Experience in R studio, data modeling, hypothesis testing is a plus

[
Overview

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Booking Holdings (BKNG) company, the world’s leading provider of brands that help people book great experiences through technology, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What’s stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it’s 30°+ outside, our engineers don’t sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast – why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we’re on the subject, Agoda people come from over 74 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there – and get your career going places, too.

What You’ll Do
  • Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to understand fraud, how it relates to Agoda’s strategy and products, and how to prevent it.
  • Build advanced predictive models to understand the impact of specific fraudulent behaviors, trends and patterns.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams of data and backend engineers, analysts, user researchers, product managers and designers who are passionate about Agoda’s success
  • Build and analyze dashboards, reports and key datasets to empower operational and exploratory analysis of fraud.
  • Understand how user fraud affects other consumers of our data, including insights and feature teams, and work across the data landscape to minimize impact and drive influence wherever possible.
  • Communicate data-informed insights and recommendations to key stakeholders, engineering and product partners.


Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
  • Previous experience working in fraud detection and prevention, with an understanding of the impact that has on other areas in the company where business and product decisions are made.
  • Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
  • Data visualizations such as Tableau or your weapon of choice.
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms including classifiers, clustering algorithms, and anomaly detection a plus
  • Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)

Journey with us in this exciting period of growth. This role is open to all candidates, including international candidates currently residing in Thailand. We will provide Visa sponsorship.

Apply now!

title: Data Scientist, Capacity Forecasting
description: [  Description  Are you excited and passionate about delivering advanced analytics that directly influence the AWS S3 customer experience? Do you see yourself as a champion of innovating on behalf of the customer by turning insights into action? Come join AWS S3 Equilibrium team as Scientist in capacity forecasting and planning function. Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) delivers storage for the Internet. It provides a simple web services interface that customers use to store and retrieve any amount of , at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives them access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Amazon itself uses to run its own global network of web sites. S3 processes peaks of over 60 Tbps of traffic in a day. We maximize benefits of our scale and pass them on to our customers. By doing this, we’re creating a fundamental shift in how businesses think about managing their storage needs. As part of this team, you will work with multiple AWS teams to help forecast the S3 webserver demand. You will be a creative problem solver who is obsessed with delivering the best customer experience, as well as, a highly analytical, team-oriented individual with excellent communication skills. You will get opportunity to write good quality code and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will work with the capacity planning team to keep multiple projects on task, track and achieve organizational goals, and plan team activities. You will be a face and voice for capacity forecasting and ensure all stakeholders are aware of successes, risks, and status. You will tailor your communications to specific audiences and communicate clearly and concisely to both business and technical audiences. Key Responsibilities Include  Design and Build the forecasting approach for S3 frontend webserver capacity  Improve upon existing methodologies by developing new sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters.  Responsible for building forecast models that provide an ongoing and timely forecast for capacity planning, including rolling forecasts with business grain, variance analysis, business adjustments, and KPIs  Build customer-facing reporting tools to provide insights and metrics which track forecast performance and explain variance  Contribute to the overall product roadmap, and manage prioritization and trade-offs against customer experience. Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation, and present to business leaders.  Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent judgment, has relentlessly high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo), Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the business or the technology, is strongly oriented towards results, Thinks big.  Implement statistical or machine learning methods to solve specific business problems.   Basic Qualifications   Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or a related quantitative field with at least 5 years of working experience as a Scientist or a Masters Degree with 3 years of working experience as a Scientist.  Experience with statistical analysis, modeling, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, mining and demand modeling  Proficiency with /R or other web-based interfaces to create graphic-rich customizable plots, charts maps, etc.  Experience using one or more R, , , C++, VBA, and other programming languages  Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities of data  Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting (Redshift, SQL, MySQL)   Preferred Qualifications   Masters or PHD in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or a related quantitative field  Previous experience in a ML or scientist role with a large technology company  Experience applying various machine learning techniques, and understanding the key parameters that affect their performance  Previous experience with demand and capacity forecasting  Experience in creating driven visualizations to describe an end-to-end system  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds.   Company - AMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC Job ID: A879657  Seniority level Not Applicable  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Computer Software Information Technology and Services Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Description

Are you excited and passionate about delivering advanced analytics that directly influence the AWS S3 customer experience? Do you see yourself as a champion of innovating on behalf of the customer by turning insights into action? Come join AWS S3 Equilibrium team as Scientist in capacity forecasting and planning function.

Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) delivers storage for the Internet. It provides a simple web services interface that customers use to store and retrieve any amount of , at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives them access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Amazon itself uses to run its own global network of web sites. S3 processes peaks of over 60 Tbps of traffic in a day. We maximize benefits of our scale and pass them on to our customers. By doing this, we’re creating a fundamental shift in how businesses think about managing their storage needs.

As part of this team, you will work with multiple AWS teams to help forecast the S3 webserver demand. You will be a creative problem solver who is obsessed with delivering the best customer experience, as well as, a highly analytical, team-oriented individual with excellent communication skills. You will get opportunity to write good quality code and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will work with the capacity planning team to keep multiple projects on task, track and achieve organizational goals, and plan team activities. You will be a face and voice for capacity forecasting and ensure all stakeholders are aware of successes, risks, and status. You will tailor your communications to specific audiences and communicate clearly and concisely to both business and technical audiences.

Key Responsibilities Include
  • Design and Build the forecasting approach for S3 frontend webserver capacity
  • Improve upon existing methodologies by developing new sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters.
  • Responsible for building forecast models that provide an ongoing and timely forecast for capacity planning, including rolling forecasts with business grain, variance analysis, business adjustments, and KPIs
  • Build customer-facing reporting tools to provide insights and metrics which track forecast performance and explain variance
  • Contribute to the overall product roadmap, and manage prioritization and trade-offs against customer experience. Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation, and present to business leaders.
  • Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent judgment, has relentlessly high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo), Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the business or the technology, is strongly oriented towards results, Thinks big.
  • Implement statistical or machine learning methods to solve specific business problems.

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or a related quantitative field with at least 5 years of working experience as a Scientist or a Masters Degree with 3 years of working experience as a Scientist.
  • Experience with statistical analysis, modeling, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, mining and demand modeling
  • Proficiency with /R or other web-based interfaces to create graphic-rich customizable plots, charts maps, etc.
  • Experience using one or more R, , , C++, VBA, and other programming languages
  • Experience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities of data
  • Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting (Redshift, SQL, MySQL)
Preferred Qualifications
  • Masters or PHD in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or a related quantitative field
  • Previous experience in a ML or scientist role with a large technology company
  • Experience applying various machine learning techniques, and understanding the key parameters that affect their performance
  • Previous experience with demand and capacity forecasting
  • Experience in creating driven visualizations to describe an end-to-end system
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds.

Company - AMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC
Job ID: A879657

    Not Applicable

  • Employment type

    Full-time

title: Sr Data Engineer
description: [  Description  The Mobile Growth team’s mission is to create experiences that will inspire the customer to more deeply engage with the shopping app. The Mobile Growth Analytics team plays a critical role in building the foundational analytics infrastructure that powers the mobile shopping business, enables teams to personalize and optimize customer experiences based on engagement, and enables teams to better understand customer behavior. We innovate to unlock the potential of the organization to analyze customer behavior and have created a data lake and front end visualization platform that over 300 users rely on to better understand mobile customer behavior. Join us to directly shape and influence the future growth around Mobile @ Amazon! This role requires you to live at the cross section of data, engineering, and the mobile business. You have a deep understanding of data, analytical techniques, and how to connect insights to the business, and you have practical experience in insisting on highest standards on operations in ETL and big data pipelines. Your responsibilities include big data design and analysis, data modeling, and development, deployment, and operations of big data pipelines. You will work closely with the software development engineering team to fundamentally redesign the Mobile Metrics infrastructure. You will raise the bar for our engineers to better understand the data flows, infrastructure options, and innovate with them where the options do not meet our needs. You will be part of a broader cross-functional Mobile Growth Analytics team and problem solve together how we can improve how data unlocks value for customers. The Mobile Growth Analytics team is a fast paced environment where every day brings new challenges and new opportunities. As a Data Engineer working on the analytics platform, you will be implementing and supporting the analytic technologies that give our customers timely, flexible and structured access to their data. You will interact with customers to gather requirements and structure solutions. Design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions. Promote industry standard best practices. Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and gaining a deep-dive understanding of key datasets. At Amazon you will see results from your work as the insights we generate will unlock new initiatives to improve the customer experience. We are looking for candidates that have strong computer science credentials, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality solutions. You know how to build and you dive deep into data. You intrinsically use technology to solve problems, excel in data analysis and can succinctly and accurately report your findings. You will contribute to all aspects of our system’s design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You will improve our data pipelines and mine new sources of data to make our system better. For this brand new initiate with highly-motivated engineers, you will help deliver robust data, feature sets, intuitive designs and user interfaces that will deliver a Mobile Analytics Platform at Amazon scale.   Basic Qualifications   Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or a related field (e.g. financial statistics etc).  5+ years of Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g. Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, and Data Scientist) with extensive professional experience and a proven track record in a role focused on understanding, manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.  Significant experience in relational database concepts with an expert knowledge of SQL.  Significant experience with relational and star schema data modeling concepts.  Experience processing noSql data  Demonstrated ability in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing  Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language.  Experience with Linux systems command-line tools and scripting  Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Pig, Spark, etc.)  Strong written and verbal English communication skills.   Preferred Qualifications   Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets.  Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including implementation and tuning experience using AWS technologies – Redshift,S3,EC2 etc and Hadoop, Hbase, Hive, Pig and other big data technologies.  Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources.  Experience with OBIEE, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc. BI packages.  Familiarity with ETL such as Informatica.  Experience using machine learning and statistical tools such as Python/Pandas, R, SPSS, Weka etc .  Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers. description_raw:
[
Description

The Mobile Growth team’s mission is to create experiences that will inspire the customer to more deeply engage with the shopping app. The Mobile Growth Analytics team plays a critical role in building the foundational analytics infrastructure that powers the mobile shopping business, enables teams to personalize and optimize customer experiences based on engagement, and enables teams to better understand customer behavior. We innovate to unlock the potential of the organization to analyze customer behavior and have created a data lake and front end visualization platform that over 300 users rely on to better understand mobile customer behavior. Join us to directly shape and influence the future growth around Mobile @ Amazon!

This role requires you to live at the cross section of data, engineering, and the mobile business. You have a deep understanding of data, analytical techniques, and how to connect insights to the business, and you have practical experience in insisting on highest standards on operations in ETL and big data pipelines. Your responsibilities include big data design and analysis, data modeling, and development, deployment, and operations of big data pipelines. You will work closely with the software development engineering team to fundamentally redesign the Mobile Metrics infrastructure. You will raise the bar for our engineers to better understand the data flows, infrastructure options, and innovate with them where the options do not meet our needs. You will be part of a broader cross-functional Mobile Growth Analytics team and problem solve together how we can improve how data unlocks value for customers.
The Mobile Growth Analytics team is a fast paced environment where every day brings new challenges and new opportunities. As a Data Engineer working on the analytics platform, you will be implementing and supporting the analytic technologies that give our customers timely, flexible and structured access to their data. You will interact with customers to gather requirements and structure solutions. Design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions. Promote industry standard best practices. Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and gaining a deep-dive understanding of key datasets.
At Amazon you will see results from your work as the insights we generate will unlock new initiatives to improve the customer experience.

We are looking for candidates that have strong computer science credentials, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality solutions. You know how to build and you dive deep into data. You intrinsically use technology to solve problems, excel in data analysis and can succinctly and accurately report your findings. You will contribute to all aspects of our system’s design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You will improve our data pipelines and mine new sources of data to make our system better. For this brand new initiate with highly-motivated engineers, you will help deliver robust data, feature sets, intuitive designs and user interfaces that will deliver a Mobile Analytics Platform at Amazon scale.


Basic Qualifications
  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or a related field (e.g. financial statistics etc).
  • 5+ years of Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g. Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, and Data Scientist) with extensive professional experience and a proven track record in a role focused on understanding, manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.
  • Significant experience in relational database concepts with an expert knowledge of SQL.
  • Significant experience with relational and star schema data modeling concepts.
  • Experience processing noSql data
  • Demonstrated ability in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing
  • Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language.
  • Experience with Linux systems command-line tools and scripting
  • Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Pig, Spark, etc.)
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets.
  • Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including implementation and tuning experience using AWS technologies – Redshift,S3,EC2 etc and Hadoop, Hbase, Hive, Pig and other big data technologies.
  • Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources.
  • Experience with OBIEE, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc. BI packages.
  • Familiarity with ETL such as Informatica.
  • Experience using machine learning and statistical tools such as Python/Pandas, R, SPSS, Weka etc .
  • Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers.
  • Experience working in small teams and shipping products, building and developing both system prototypes and operating scalable software systems.
  • Linux/UNIX including to process large data sets.
  • Cloud computing, large-scale and high-availability distributed architecture.
  • Strong analytical and excellent problem solving skills.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Amazon Web Services- Big Data Solutions and Development Engineering - Redshift
description: [  Description  Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS, you can requisition compute power, storage, and other services – paying as you go for only the resources you need. Amazon Redshift is rapidly growing, fast and powerful, fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service in the cloud. It enables customers to dramatically increase their query performance when analyzing virtually any size data set using the same SQL-based business intelligence tools they use today. Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. By automating these labor-intensive tasks, Amazon Redshift enables customers to spend their time focusing on their data and business insights, rather than on procuring and managing infrastructure. Joining the Amazon Redshift team gives you the opportunity to:  Solve challenging problems that will revolutionize database computing in the cloud  Build a quality product that will leverage the scale of resources available in the cloud  Work for a company that’s a recognized leader in the cloud computing space  Be involved in the fast growing, big data space  We are looking for engineers that are passionate about relational databases. This role could be 100% working with customers to help them with database design, usage troubleshooting, automation or could be internally focussed on automation/tools/demos/POC playgrounds/migrations automation etc. We expect candidates to have:    knowledge of database systems theory  working knowledge of relational databases design and usage  good coding skills  a sense for how distributed systems work in practice and their limitations  experience building and administering production databases  excellent troubleshooting skills  the ability and desire to learn new technologies quickly  performance benchmark background a great plus  development background if highly desirable (strong coding skills will allow for automation/demos/tools development.   Basic Qualifications   15+ years experience working on large scale systems and databases  Excelent working knowledge of UNIX  Excelent problem diagnosis skills  Experience troubleshooting applications and system performance and complex, production software issues  Ability to automate tasks, write scripts, and even build tools as needed to make the job simples  Ability to benchmark products and contrast the various behaviors  Development skills are highly desirable  Ability to do performance analysis and get deep into root cause analysis  Experience executing and interpreting results from database performance benchmarks.  Ability to tune databases based on explain plans overall system behavior. Ability to tune complex workloads.  Ability to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects  Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment  Possess excellent communication skills and experience working with external customers (both technical and non-technical audiences).  Masters in Computer Science or Engineering   Preferred Qualifications   Experience administering large database fleets a plus (&gt1000)  Advanced SQL coding, tuning and query optimization  Knowlege of database internals as it relates to query and system peformance and tuning  Understanding of overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance in a database environment  Experience designing and leading database performance benchmarks.  Experience with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing  Strong development background, strong coding skills  Masters or PhD in Computer Science  Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation  Company - AMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC Job ID: A897244  Seniority level Not Applicable  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology Consulting Engineering  Industries Computer Software Information Technology and Services Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS, you can requisition compute power, storage, and other services – paying as you go for only the resources you need. Amazon Redshift is rapidly growing, fast and powerful, fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service in the cloud. It enables customers to dramatically increase their query performance when analyzing virtually any size data set using the same SQL-based business intelligence tools they use today. Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. By automating these labor-intensive tasks, Amazon Redshift enables customers to spend their time focusing on their data and business insights, rather than on procuring and managing infrastructure.

Joining the Amazon Redshift team gives you the opportunity to:
  • Solve challenging problems that will revolutionize database computing in the cloud
  • Build a quality product that will leverage the scale of resources available in the cloud
  • Work for a company that’s a recognized leader in the cloud computing space
  • Be involved in the fast growing, big data space
We are looking for engineers that are passionate about relational databases. This role could be 100% working with customers to help them with database design, usage troubleshooting, automation or could be internally focussed on automation/tools/demos/POC playgrounds/migrations automation etc. We expect candidates to have:  
  • knowledge of database systems theory
  • working knowledge of relational databases design and usage
  • good coding skills
  • a sense for how distributed systems work in practice and their limitations
  • experience building and administering production databases
  • excellent troubleshooting skills
  • the ability and desire to learn new technologies quickly
  • performance benchmark background a great plus
  • development background if highly desirable (strong coding skills will allow for automation/demos/tools development.

Basic Qualifications
  • 15+ years experience working on large scale systems and databases
  • Excelent working knowledge of UNIX
  • Excelent problem diagnosis skills
  • Experience troubleshooting applications and system performance and complex, production software issues
  • Ability to automate tasks, write scripts, and even build tools as needed to make the job simples
  • Ability to benchmark products and contrast the various behaviors
  • Development skills are highly desirable
  • Ability to do performance analysis and get deep into root cause analysis
  • Experience executing and interpreting results from database performance benchmarks.
  • Ability to tune databases based on explain plans overall system behavior. Ability to tune complex workloads.
  • Ability to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment
  • Possess excellent communication skills and experience working with external customers (both technical and non-technical audiences).
  • Masters in Computer Science or Engineering
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience administering large database fleets a plus (&gt1000)
  • Advanced SQL coding, tuning and query optimization
  • Knowlege of database internals as it relates to query and system peformance and tuning
  • Understanding of overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance in a database environment
  • Experience designing and leading database performance benchmarks.
  • Experience with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing
  • Strong development background, strong coding skills
  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Data Scientist II
description: [  Description  Terms of employment: Full time, permanent Job location: 510 West Georgia Street, Vancouver, V6B 0M3 The Smart Home team is focused on making Alexa the user interface for the home. From the simplest voice commands (turn on the lights, turn down the heat) to use cases spanning home security, home entertainment, and the home environment, we are evolving Alexa into intelligent, indispensable companion that automates daily routines, simplifies interaction with appliances and electronics, and alerts when something unusual is detected. You will be part of a team delivering features that are highly anticipated by media and well received by our customers. Here are a few links that highlight working with Alexa.  Meet The Alexa Software Team  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KpXEsrjcj6Y  Charlie Kindel, Director, Alexa Smart Home, CEDIA Keynote  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tatp2M5hG-M Amazon Echo Emerges as a Surprise Leader in Smart Home Platform War: [url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/aarontilley/  You Can Make Your Amazon Alexa Smarter  [url=http://fortune.com/video/ How to make the Amazon Echo the Center of Your Smart Home: [url=http://www.wired.com/ As a Machine Learning Scientist, you will work with software developers and other teams to design and implement NLU models for how customers use and interact with smart devices in their homes. You will help lay the foundation to move from directed device interactions to learned behaviors that enable Alexa to proactively take action on behalf of the customer. And, you will have the satisfaction of working on a product your friends and family can relate to, and want to use every day. Like the world of smart phones less than 10 years ago, this is a rare opportunity to have a giant impact on the way people live. Salary $88,200 to $147,300/yr, commensurate with experience   Basic Qualifications   Master or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics or a related quantitative field.  4+ years of hands-on experience in applied machine learning, and predictive modeling and analysis.  Algorithm and model development experience for large-scale applications  Experience using Python, or other programming or scripting language, as well as with R, MATLAB.  Solid understanding of foundational statistics concepts, NLU and ML algorithms: linear/logistic regression, random forest, boosting, GBM, NNs, etc.  Language required for job: English   Preferred Qualifications  All applicants must meet qualifications above. Benefits: Amazon provides a full range of benefits for our global employees and their eligible family members. Eligible employees may also receive signing bonuses and Amazon Restricted Stock Units. This position is eligible for further pay increases and bonuses at the company's discretion. While they might vary from location to location, Amazon benefits for Canada may include:  Health Care  Savings Plans  Income Protection  Paid Time Off  Employee Stock  Signing Bonuses  Amazon offers competitive packages, growth potential and a challenging and exciting work environment. Amazon and its affiliates are Equal Opportunity Employers. Visit www.Amazon.com/careers for more information.  Company - AMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC Job ID: A877427  Seniority level Mid-Senior level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Computer Software Information Technology and Services Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Description

Terms of employment: Full time, permanent

Job location: 510 West Georgia Street, Vancouver, V6B 0M3

The Smart Home team is focused on making Alexa the user interface for the home. From the simplest voice commands (turn on the lights, turn down the heat) to use cases spanning home security, home entertainment, and the home environment, we are evolving Alexa into intelligent, indispensable companion that automates daily routines, simplifies interaction with appliances and electronics, and alerts when something unusual is detected.

You will be part of a team delivering features that are highly anticipated by media and well received by our customers. Here are a few links that highlight working with Alexa.

Meet The Alexa Software Team

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KpXEsrjcj6Y

Charlie Kindel, Director, Alexa Smart Home, CEDIA Keynote

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tatp2M5hG-M
Amazon Echo Emerges as a Surprise Leader in Smart Home Platform War:
[url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/aarontilley/

You Can Make Your Amazon Alexa Smarter

[url=http://fortune.com/video/
How to make the Amazon Echo the Center of Your Smart Home:
[url=http://www.wired.com/

As a Machine Learning Scientist, you will work with software developers and other teams to design and implement NLU models for how customers use and interact with smart devices in their homes. You will help lay the foundation to move from directed device interactions to learned behaviors that enable Alexa to proactively take action on behalf of the customer. And, you will have the satisfaction of working on a product your friends and family can relate to, and want to use every day. Like the world of smart phones less than 10 years ago, this is a rare opportunity to have a giant impact on the way people live.

Salary $88,200 to $147,300/yr, commensurate with experience


Basic Qualifications
  • Master or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics or a related quantitative field.
  • 4+ years of hands-on experience in applied machine learning, and predictive modeling and analysis.
  • Algorithm and model development experience for large-scale applications
  • Experience using Python, or other programming or scripting language, as well as with R, MATLAB.
  • Solid understanding of foundational statistics concepts, NLU and ML algorithms: linear/logistic regression, random forest, boosting, GBM, NNs, etc.
Language required for job: English


Preferred Qualifications

All applicants must meet qualifications above.

Benefits: Amazon provides a full range of benefits for our global employees and their eligible family members. Eligible employees may also receive signing bonuses and Amazon Restricted Stock Units. This position is eligible for further pay increases and bonuses at the company's discretion. While they might vary from location to location, Amazon benefits for Canada may include:
  • Health Care
  • Savings Plans
  • Income Protection
  • Paid Time Off
  • Employee Stock
  • Signing Bonuses
Amazon offers competitive packages, growth potential and a challenging and exciting work environment. Amazon and its affiliates are Equal Opportunity Employers. Visit www.Amazon.com/careers for more information.
