title: Customer Master Data Specialist
description: [  Job Description Summary The Customer Master Data Specialist position reports to the Manager, Master Data Management and is responsible for customer data across all STEMCELL systems. Job Description   Duties And Responsibilities   Define & implement customer data management methodologies that support STEMCELL’s strategy around customer growth and retention. Own the team responsible for new customer onboarding, data maintenance, quality assurance, corporate & reporting hierarchy management, and change control. Partner with Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service, Finance & IT teams to define the data lifecycle of the customer at STEMCELL and deploy effective data acquisition, integration, management & mastering methodologies Define and lead data improvement programs used to advance content management operations Establish a workflow based service request process to document and implement data management tasks Define and deploy performance based metrics scorecards across the customer data operations pipeline to identify process risks and efficiency opportunities Work closely with data quality, metadata and lineage services to ensure conformance of content to enterprise data content, sourcing, and distribution standards Provide coaching and mentorship to Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service to improve operational excellence Maintain & catalog structured content intake, management and distribution processes Collaborate with IT to deploy appropriate tools & processes to support data entry, de-duplication, and mastering. Implement training and education program for customer data consumers to build balanced understanding and use of customer content Ensure compliance with internal data policies and external regulatory requirements   Qualifications   Minimum of 4 years of related experience in Data Scientist/Operations Master level functional depth of customer, master data in S/4 Experience working with enterprise platforms such as SFDC, and SQL Server strongly preferred S/4 data architecture and data modeling experience SAP Information Steward architect and data quality leadership and implementation experience Data cleansing implementation experience Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines Strong interpersonal, verbal/written communication, organization and customer service skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and simultaneously manage multiple projects, priorities and deadlines; outstanding project management and time management skills Advanced knowledge of MS Office and G Suite applications  STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada. This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities. To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply. Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number. Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Other  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Biotechnology  ]
description_raw:
[
Job Description SummaryThe Customer Master Data Specialist position reports to the Manager, Master Data Management and is responsible for customer data across all STEMCELL systems.Job Description

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Define & implement customer data management methodologies that support STEMCELL’s strategy around customer growth and retention.
  • Own the team responsible for new customer onboarding, data maintenance, quality assurance, corporate & reporting hierarchy management, and change control.
  • Partner with Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service, Finance & IT teams to define the data lifecycle of the customer at STEMCELL and deploy effective data acquisition, integration, management & mastering methodologies
  • Define and lead data improvement programs used to advance content management operations
  • Establish a workflow based service request process to document and implement data management tasks
  • Define and deploy performance based metrics scorecards across the customer data operations pipeline to identify process risks and efficiency opportunities
  • Work closely with data quality, metadata and lineage services to ensure conformance of content to enterprise data content, sourcing, and distribution standards
  • Provide coaching and mentorship to Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service to improve operational excellence
  • Maintain & catalog structured content intake, management and distribution processes
  • Collaborate with IT to deploy appropriate tools & processes to support data entry, de-duplication, and mastering.
  • Implement training and education program for customer data consumers to build balanced understanding and use of customer content
  • Ensure compliance with internal data policies and external regulatory requirements

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 4 years of related experience in Data Scientist/Operations
  • Master level functional depth of customer, master data in S/4
  • Experience working with enterprise platforms such as SFDC, and SQL Server strongly preferred
  • S/4 data architecture and data modeling experience
  • SAP Information Steward architect and data quality leadership and implementation experience
  • Data cleansing implementation experience
  • Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal/written communication, organization and customer service skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and simultaneously manage multiple projects, priorities and deadlines; outstanding project management and time management skills
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office and G Suite applications
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.

Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number. Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Other

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareBiotechnology
]

title: Software Engineer - Big Data
description: [  Job Category Products and Technology  Job Details  Software Engineers(Senior/Lead or Principal) Big Data Services  About  About Salesforce Technology, Marketing & Product Engineering Our Technology, Marketing & Products Engineering team is responsible for innovating and maintaining a massive distributed systems engineering platform that ships hundreds of features to production for tens of millions of users across all industries every day. Our users count on our platform to be highly reliable, lightning fast, supremely secure, and to preserve all of their customizations and integrations every time we ship. Our platform is deeply customizable to meet the differing demands of our vast user base, creating an exciting environment filled with complex challenges for our hundreds of agile engineering teams every day. (Check out our "We are Salesforce Engineering" video - We are Salesforce Engineering  Big Data Services Software Engineer Description  Salesforce is building out our Big Data Services team to reinvigorate the way we architect, deliver, and operate the platforms and services that run in our own data centers and also in public clouds - at consumer web scale. We are looking to add engineers, with experience building and owning distributed services, who can step up and own big chunks of this vision.  Working with Kubernetes, HDFS, Yarn, Kafka, Spark, HBase, Phoenix, Hive, Presto or equivalent large-scale distributed systems technologies Eat, sleep, and breathe services. You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debt Knowledge of CAP theorem. Consistency models and how they apply to their services. description_raw:
[
Job Category
Products and Technology

Job Details

Software Engineers(Senior/Lead or Principal) Big Data Services

About

About Salesforce Technology, Marketing & Product Engineering

Our Technology, Marketing & Products Engineering team is responsible for innovating and maintaining a massive distributed systems engineering platform that ships hundreds of features to production for tens of millions of users across all industries every day. Our users count on our platform to be highly reliable, lightning fast, supremely secure, and to preserve all of their customizations and integrations every time we ship. Our platform is deeply customizable to meet the differing demands of our vast user base, creating an exciting environment filled with complex challenges for our hundreds of agile engineering teams every day.

(Check out our "We are Salesforce Engineering" video -
We are Salesforce Engineering

Big Data Services Software Engineer Description

Salesforce is building out our Big Data Services team to reinvigorate the way we architect, deliver, and operate the platforms and services that run in our own data centers and also in public clouds - at consumer web scale. We are looking to add engineers, with experience building and owning distributed services, who can step up and own big chunks of this vision.
  • Working with Kubernetes, HDFS, Yarn, Kafka, Spark, HBase, Phoenix, Hive, Presto or equivalent large-scale distributed systems technologies
  • Eat, sleep, and breathe services. You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debt
  • Knowledge of CAP theorem. Consistency models and how they apply to their services.
  • Familiarity with crash-only and recovery-oriented software design
  • Excited by building reliable, self-healing services on unreliable hardware
  • Experience designing, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems that run across thousands of compute nodes in multiple datacenters
  • You haven’t just used, but have built and operated the distributed platforms that define cloud-scale infrastructure

Requirements
  • 5-10 years of development experience
  • Experience with Java and/or C++ in a Linux/UNIX data center environment
  • Experience with one or more of: Spark, Kubernetes, Docker, Hadoop, Spinnaker, Terraform
  • Experience with Hadoop or/and HBase or Phoenix
  • Experience owning and operating multiple instances of a mission-critical service
  • Experience with Agile development methodology and Test-Driven Development
  • Experience using telemetry and metrics to drive operational excellence

Education
  • MS in Computer Engineer/Science or related field, or
  • BS in Computer Engineer/Science plus relevant job-related experience

Are you an upcoming or recent graduate (within the past 2.5 years)? Please check out our FutureForce program at www.salesforce.com/futureforce . We appreciate your interest but we are seeking industry experienced engineers.

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

Salesforce information
Salesforce Ohana Culture
https://medium.com/salesforce-engineering

Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

title: Data Analyst
description: [ Excellent opportunity for a positive, self-motivated, inquisitive and highly organized individual with an aptitude for analyzing and interpreting data.  The Successful Candidate   Must have exceptional communication (both verbal and written) and analytical skills with a strong attention to detail.  Able to work collaboratively as part of a team.  Advanced knowledge of computer systems and software required, particularly with Excel, Opera, Maestro, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Automated Revenue Management Systems and Synxis.  Additional language(s) and database knowledge is an asset.  Duties and Responsibilities  Develop strategies for effective data analysis and communication with effective presentation of findings  Extract reports and data from multiple sources then clearly summarize  Define approaches to transform raw data into actionable business insights.  Apply industry knowledge to explain data and improve performance.  Keep abreast of industry news and trends.  Analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.  Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.  Execute special projects  A competitive salary and work from home are benefits associated with this position.   Summation  Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required. You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker. Applications will not be accepted via email or in person. We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application. ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.  Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services  ]
description_raw:
[
Excellent opportunity for a positive, self-motivated, inquisitive and highly organized individual with an aptitude for analyzing and interpreting data.

The Successful Candidate
  • Must have exceptional communication (both verbal and written) and analytical skills with a strong attention to detail.
  • Able to work collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Advanced knowledge of computer systems and software required, particularly with Excel, Opera, Maestro, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Automated Revenue Management Systems and Synxis.
  • Additional language(s) and database knowledge is an asset.
Duties and Responsibilities
  • Develop strategies for effective data analysis and communication with effective presentation of findings
  • Extract reports and data from multiple sources then clearly summarize
  • Define approaches to transform raw data into actionable business insights.
  • Apply industry knowledge to explain data and improve performance.
  • Keep abreast of industry news and trends.
  • Analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Execute special projects
  • A competitive salary and work from home are benefits associated with this position.
Summation

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required. You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker. Applications will not be accepted via email or in person. We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.
ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE
Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

    Information Technology and Services

We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions. description_raw:
[
Join our team

Do you thrive in a fast-paced, team centric environment? Are you a detailed-oriented individual who loves solving problems by leveraging creative solutions? Do you want to be in a space where your knowledge and experience are used and fostered? Read on as this is the job for you!

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a key member of the TELUS Health team, you will be joining a growing team of Analysts in transforming and converting health data for Canadian physicians on a TELUS Electronic Medical Record (EMR) platform. This exciting opportunity will allow you to leverage your experience and skillset within an innovative and collaborative environment while performing meaningful work that is crucial to the success of our TELUS Health EMR platforms.

Here’s How
  • Extracting data from various source systems and data stores by performing light business coding: Java, Python, C#, etc
  • Connecting with our customers to conduct requirement gathering and performing data validations
  • Mapping and transforming data using various techniques: eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT), MapForce, scripting, etc., based on customer input and requirements
  • Performing ad-hoc queries: SQL, Language-Integrated Query (LINQ), etc., and reports to analyse customer data before and after migration
  • Planning and performing go-live transformation and validation to ensure no data is lost or corrupted
  • Executing production data migrations; requires occasional evening/weekend work
  • Collaboration with various teams across the business to identify roadblocks and resolve issues, to ensure timely completion for each project
  • Contributing to on-going development and refinement of data migration tools and processes
  • Tracking issues, communicating project status, and managing project risk


Primary Location

CA-British Columbia

Other Locations

CA-BC-Victoria, CA-BC-Kelowna, CA-BC-Vancouver

Schedule

Full-time

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
  • Technical Knowledge:
    • Structured Query Language (SQL)/Transact SQL
    • Data transformation scripting & mapping: eXtensible Markup Language (XML), eXtensible Stylesheet Language (XSL)/XPath
    • Familiarity with databases such as Microsoft (MS) SQL, Oracle, MySQL, etc
    • Scripting: Python/Groovy or development: Java/C#
    • Linux/Unix & Groovy is an asset
    • MapForce is an asset
  • Functional Skills:
    • Detail oriented
    • Avid problem solver
    • Ability to communicate both verbally and written in English & French is an asset
    • Ability to multi-task and manage numerous concurrent projects
    • Strong analysis and problem solving skills with the ability to identify root cause
    • Ability to communicate in an effective and respectful manner with customers and fellow team members
    • Self-directed in completing project-based work
  • The following roles must have the required education & experience as listed below:
    • Data Analyst I:
      • Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution with a diploma specializing in related technologies
      • 1 year of minimum experience working on data transformation, development, or school related projects
    • Data Analyst II:
      • Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution with a degree specializing in related technologies
      • 2+ years of experience working on data transformation or development projects
      • 2+ years of working with SQL/TSQL
      • 2+ years of working with XML and related tools: XSL/XPath
      • 2+ years of working with a scripting language: Bash/JavaScript/Python/Perl/etc
    • Data Analyst III:
      • Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution specializing in related technologies
      • 5+ years of experience working on data transformation or development projects
      • 5+ years of working with SQL/TSQL
      • 5+ years of working with XML and related tools: XSL/XPath
      • 5+ years of working with a scripting language: Bash/JavaScript/Python/Perl/etc

Great-to-haves
  • Agile & Project Management skills
  • Understanding of network infrastructure
  • Medical experience or clinical workflow
  • Experience with Health Level Seven International (HL7), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and Core Data Set (CDS)/Clinical Management Systems(CMS) XML standards
  • Experience with the Atlassian tool suite: Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence


What YOU Get

Great pay, profit sharing bonus, stock purchase plan, dedication to team engagement; career development, flexible benefit plan with many innovative options and programs, DC Pension, flexible work styles, and more!

Who is TELUS?

We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.

TELUS Health is an IT leader in Canada that focuses on the health sector. Our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.

Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.

Do you share our passion?

At TELUS, you create future friendly ® possibilities.

At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

Disclaimer: In accordance with the TELUS Health Solutions Data Center Security Policy, as a condition of employment, all personnel whose job functions require they work at a Data Center and/or have access to detailed knowledge of technology related to client service delivery, are subject to a Personnel Security Screening conducted through the Government of Canada.

  • Seniority level

    Not Applicable

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesTelecommunicationsUtilities
]

    • Technical Knowledge: Structured Query Language (SQL)/Transact SQL Data transformation scripting & mapping: eXtensible Markup Language (XML), eXtensible Stylesheet Language (XSL)/XPath Familiarity with databases such as Microsoft (MS) SQL, Oracle, MySQL, etc Scripting: Python/Groovy or development: Java/C# Linux/Unix & Groovy is an asset MapForce is an asset
    • Functional Skills: Detail oriented Avid problem solver Ability to communicate both verbally and written in English & French is an asset Ability to multi-task and manage numerous concurrent projects Strong analysis and problem solving skills with the ability to identify root cause Ability to communicate in an effective and respectful manner with customers and fellow team members Self-directed in completing project-based work
    • The following roles must have the required education & experience as listed below: Data Analyst I: Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution with a diploma specializing in related technologies 1 year of minimum experience working on data transformation, development, or school related projects Data Analyst II: Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution with a degree specializing in related technologies 2+ years of experience working on data transformation or development projects 2+ years of working with SQL/TSQL 2+ years of working with XML and related tools: XSL/XPath 2+ years of working with a scripting language: Bash/JavaScript/Python/Perl/etc Data Analyst III: Diploma/degree from a post-secondary institution specializing in related technologies 5+ years of experience working on data transformation or development projects 5+ years of working with SQL/TSQL 5+ years of working with XML and related tools: XSL/XPath 5+ years of working with a scripting language: Bash/JavaScript/Python/Perl/etc
      • Great-to-haves
    • Agile & Project Management skills
    • Understanding of network infrastructure
    • Medical experience or clinical workflow
    • Experience with Health Level Seven International (HL7), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) and Core Data Set (CDS)/Clinical Management Systems(CMS) XML standards
    • Experience with the Atlassian tool suite: Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence
      • What YOU Get:
      Great pay, profit sharing bonus, stock purchase plan, dedication to team engagement; career development, flexible benefit plan with many innovative options and programs, DC Pension, flexible work styles, and more!
      Who is TELUS?
      We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.

      TELUS Health is an IT leader in Canada that focuses on the health sector. Our mission is to improve the way information is being used along the continuum of care to better the health of citizens in Canada and in selected countries.

      Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.
      Do you share our passion? At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.
      At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

      Disclaimer: In accordance with the TELUS Health Solutions Data Center Security Policy, as a condition of employment, all personnel whose job functions require they work at a Data Center and/or have access to detailed knowledge of technology related to client service delivery, are subject to a Personnel Security Screening conducted through the Government of Canada.

    • Seniority level

      Entry level

    • Employment type

      Full-time

    • Job function

      Information Technology

    • Industries

      Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareFinancial Services
    ]

title: Data Analyst (Temporary)
description: [  Closing Date: 30 August 2019 Reporting to the Manager, Geophysics & Innovation - Geoscience, the Data Analyst will support various data and information management initiatives within the Exploration and Geoscience Services groups. General areas of focus will be the development and support of shared online group-wide information repositories, testing of collaboration and business efficiency tools and implementation of business intelligence reporting. The Data Analyst may also provide basic support in workflows for recording, storing, and managing geospatial data and/or validating information of various form and type.  Responsibilities   Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures Support the development of (and migration of business content to) a group-wide SharePoint Online environment.  Assist with the implementatin of Microsoft Teams workspaces. Develop training and best practice documentation to support change management. Assist with adoption of applications in the Microsoft 365 for Business environment. Assist with the development of mobile applications in Microsoft PowerApps.  Support the roll-out of business intelligence reports.  Use of Power BI software platform to develop reports as directed. Support user training initiatives. Maintain report integrity and data models.  Provide technical support for development of group wide knowledge sharing environments.  Develop online environments for tracking of technical opportunities and initiatives. Support information sharing and collaboration environments for ongoing initiatives.  Assist with content and permissions management on Teck’s Exploration Intranet. Assist with continuous improvement and innovation initiatives in data and content management across the group as required.   Qualifications   A Bachelor’s degree or relevant diploma in an Earth Sciences or Geoscience discipline or a specialized certification or degree in GIS, Data Management, or computing related field. 1 - 3 years of relevant industry work experience. High proficiency using the Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Familiarity with Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft 365 for Business (including Microsoft Flow and PowerApps) and Power BI is preferred. Skills in coding and scripting languages including Python and SQL would be an asset. Basic experience in spatial database software, systems, and structure (GIS / ESRI based and SQL) would be an asset. Detail oriented, organized and process driven. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment is required.  At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution. Qualified applicants interested in joining a dynamic team are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter electronically. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information. Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK. The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck’s approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck’s sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world’s 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index. Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.   Seniority level Associate  Employment type Temporary  Job function Information Technology  Industries Construction Mining & Metals Human Resources  ]
description_raw:
[
Closing Date: 30 August 2019

Reporting to the Manager, Geophysics & Innovation - Geoscience, the Data Analyst will support various data and information management initiatives within the Exploration and Geoscience Services groups. General areas of focus will be the development and support of shared online group-wide information repositories, testing of collaboration and business efficiency tools and implementation of business intelligence reporting. The Data Analyst may also provide basic support in workflows for recording, storing, and managing geospatial data and/or validating information of various form and type.

Responsibilities

  • Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
  • Support the development of (and migration of business content to) a group-wide SharePoint Online environment.

    • Assist with the implementatin of Microsoft Teams workspaces.
    • Develop training and best practice documentation to support change management.
    • Assist with adoption of applications in the Microsoft 365 for Business environment.
    • Assist with the development of mobile applications in Microsoft PowerApps.
  • Support the roll-out of business intelligence reports.

    • Use of Power BI software platform to develop reports as directed.
    • Support user training initiatives.
    • Maintain report integrity and data models.
  • Provide technical support for development of group wide knowledge sharing environments.

    • Develop online environments for tracking of technical opportunities and initiatives.
    • Support information sharing and collaboration environments for ongoing initiatives.
  • Assist with content and permissions management on Teck’s Exploration Intranet.
  • Assist with continuous improvement and innovation initiatives in data and content management across the group as required.

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree or relevant diploma in an Earth Sciences or Geoscience discipline or a specialized certification or degree in GIS, Data Management, or computing related field.
  • 1 - 3 years of relevant industry work experience.
  • High proficiency using the Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft 365 for Business (including Microsoft Flow and PowerApps) and Power BI is preferred.
  • Skills in coding and scripting languages including Python and SQL would be an asset.
  • Basic experience in spatial database software, systems, and structure (GIS / ESRI based and SQL) would be an asset.
  • Detail oriented, organized and process driven.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment is required.

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Qualified applicants interested in joining a dynamic team are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter electronically.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck’s approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck’s sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world’s 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

title: Data Science Specialist
description: [  Role: Data Analyst  Job Location: Vancouver, B.C. (Downtown)  Role Type: Full-time, Permanent  Hours: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm  Pay: Competitive salary plus benefits and office perks  About Thrive  We're on the hunt for a smart, enthusiastic, data oriented person who gets excited at the idea of working to generate data driven insights and testing frameworks for some of the world's most cutting edge and disruptive companies. Thrive builds and implements digital marketing campaigns that are seen by millions of people around the world each year. You may not realize it, but you've probably seen some of our work with startups, Fortune 500 companies, and companies of all sizes in between (Uber, AMER, Snapchat, Meetup, Earnest - to name a few!). Our mission is to grow your favorite companies, and as a result, we have developed a deep expertise in performance marketing, brand marketing, digital design and a scrappy approach to getting things done. Our culture is centered around creativity with data, technical expertise, providing a premium level of service, and managing our company differently than other agencies.  About You  Your background might be from a variety of different disciplines, but you have a deep understanding and can to spearhead data analysis projects with scientific rigor and statistical methods. You should also love the idea of architecting how to build statistical testing frameworks to overcome the challenges of data quality and driving quality insights that positively impact client performance. You are also familiar with data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations; demonstrate a positive can-do attitude, work well in teams, and enjoy solving complex problems. You demonstrate first class communication skills, excellent writing skills and the ability to multitask a variety of goals and deadlines in a constantly changing environment. You want to advance your career by joining one of North America's top performance marketing teams.  Areas Of Experience  Ideal candidates have experience in some of the following areas:  Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical/Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experience  1+ year of relevant work experience an asset  Advanced statistical techniques and procedures, such as descriptive statistics, correlation and regression analysis  Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement or further testing  Create practical methods to forecast demand, simulate business outcomes for clients, and optimize budgeting across a range of different advertising platforms  Comfortable being able to be a thought leader on how testing is performed at scale in a scientific manner  Experience with one or more programming languages (C++, Python, Java, R)  Experience with SQL, data processing software (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and tools (MapReduce, Flume)  Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL, and reporting/analytics tools and environments  Data visualization platforms (PowerBI, Tableau, Domo)  Experience creating custom data models to help predict future results  Experience with linear and logistic regression, decision tree models and PCA  Knowledge of bayesian and frequentist statistics as it pertains to experimental testing  Experience automating complex data manipulation/cleanup tasks  Ability to work cross functionally with technical and business stakeholders with demonstrated listening, critical thinking, and problem solving skills  Drive storytelling with data via presentations designing charts, tables, diagrams, and graphs for reporting and recording data  Breakdown complex concepts into their core components and communicate to audiences who are not as data savvy   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Marketing and Advertising Computer Software Internet  ]
description_raw:
[
Role: Data Analyst

Job Location: Vancouver, B.C. (Downtown)

Role Type: Full-time, Permanent

Hours: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm

Pay: Competitive salary plus benefits and office perks

About Thrive

We're on the hunt for a smart, enthusiastic, data oriented person who gets excited at the idea of working to generate data driven insights and testing frameworks for some of the world's most cutting edge and disruptive companies.

Thrive builds and implements digital marketing campaigns that are seen by millions of people around the world each year. You may not realize it, but you've probably seen some of our work with startups, Fortune 500 companies, and companies of all sizes in between (Uber, AMER, Snapchat, Meetup, Earnest - to name a few!). Our mission is to grow your favorite companies, and as a result, we have developed a deep expertise in performance marketing, brand marketing, digital design and a scrappy approach to getting things done. Our culture is centered around creativity with data, technical expertise, providing a premium level of service, and managing our company differently than other agencies.

About You

Your background might be from a variety of different disciplines, but you have a deep understanding and can to spearhead data analysis projects with scientific rigor and statistical methods. You should also love the idea of architecting how to build statistical testing frameworks to overcome the challenges of data quality and driving quality insights that positively impact client performance. You are also familiar with data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations; demonstrate a positive can-do attitude, work well in teams, and enjoy solving complex problems. You demonstrate first class communication skills, excellent writing skills and the ability to multitask a variety of goals and deadlines in a constantly changing environment. You want to advance your career by joining one of North America's top performance marketing teams.

Areas Of Experience

Ideal candidates have experience in some of the following areas:
  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical/Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experience
  • 1+ year of relevant work experience an asset
  • Advanced statistical techniques and procedures, such as descriptive statistics, correlation and regression analysis
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement or further testing
  • Create practical methods to forecast demand, simulate business outcomes for clients, and optimize budgeting across a range of different advertising platforms
  • Comfortable being able to be a thought leader on how testing is performed at scale in a scientific manner
  • Experience with one or more programming languages (C++, Python, Java, R)
  • Experience with SQL, data processing software (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and tools (MapReduce, Flume)
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL, and reporting/analytics tools and environments
  • Data visualization platforms (PowerBI, Tableau, Domo)
  • Experience creating custom data models to help predict future results
  • Experience with linear and logistic regression, decision tree models and PCA
  • Knowledge of bayesian and frequentist statistics as it pertains to experimental testing
  • Experience automating complex data manipulation/cleanup tasks
  • Ability to work cross functionally with technical and business stakeholders with demonstrated listening, critical thinking, and problem solving skills
  • Drive storytelling with data via presentations designing charts, tables, diagrams, and graphs for reporting and recording data
  • Breakdown complex concepts into their core components and communicate to audiences who are not as data savvy

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    Marketing and AdvertisingComputer SoftwareInternet
]

title: Machine Learning Algorithms Engineer - DeviantArt
description: [  We Are  DeviantArt’s Artificial Intelligence team. DeviantArt is the largest online social network for artists and art enthusiasts with over 45 million registered members and more than 50 million unique visitors a month. We are a platform for emerging and established artists to exhibit, promote, and share their work with an enthusiastic, art-centric community. Machine learning systems form an integral part of our users’ experience by helping us expose users to relevant art and further foster the DeviantArt community. We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic team member who wants to help us further develop these systems with the goal of growing and strengthening DeviantArt’s network of artists, curators, organizers and general community members.  You Are  A talented data scientist experienced in developing performant, scalable algorithms for production applications. You have a strong understanding of AI and machine learning algorithms, especially for recommendation and classification. You’re an expert user of Python for data science (including scipy, numpy, sklearn, pandas, jupyter, pytorch, pyspark...) and are experienced with both traditional machine learning approaches and with deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow, Pytorch, and MXNet. You have legal status to work in Canada, and travel to the US and Israel.  As a Machine Learning Algorithms Engineer, You Will   Help design performant, scalable and maintainable machine learning algorithms that can meet key needs of the world's most active online community of artists, and are general enough to be used by other teams at Wix. Work closely with Machine Learning Platform Engineers to ensure your algorithms can be reliably deployed and operated in production at scale. Leverage the expertise and infrastructure of other Wix machine learning teams to collaboratively build end-to-end systems, going from data ingestion all the way to serving results in production. Stay up-to-date with developments in the machine learning research community and translate them into actionable suggestions for DeviantArt’s systems and goals. Help maintain, redesign and migrate existing machine learning systems on the path to new paradigms and environments. Travel occasionally to other locations in the US and/or Israel.   Seniority level Entry level  Employment type Full-time  Job function Engineering Information Technology  Industries Internet Computer Software  ]
description_raw:
[
We Are

DeviantArt’s Artificial Intelligence team. DeviantArt is the largest online social network for artists and art enthusiasts with over 45 million registered members and more than 50 million unique visitors a month. We are a platform for emerging and established artists to exhibit, promote, and share their work with an enthusiastic, art-centric community.

Machine learning systems form an integral part of our users’ experience by helping us expose users to relevant art and further foster the DeviantArt community. We’re looking for an experienced and enthusiastic team member who wants to help us further develop these systems with the goal of growing and strengthening DeviantArt’s network of artists, curators, organizers and general community members.

You Are

A talented data scientist experienced in developing performant, scalable algorithms for production applications. You have a strong understanding of AI and machine learning algorithms, especially for recommendation and classification. You’re an expert user of Python for data science (including scipy, numpy, sklearn, pandas, jupyter, pytorch, pyspark...) and are experienced with both traditional machine learning approaches and with deep learning frameworks like Tensorflow, Pytorch, and MXNet.

You have legal status to work in Canada, and travel to the US and Israel.

As a Machine Learning Algorithms Engineer, You Will
  • Help design performant, scalable and maintainable machine learning algorithms that can meet key needs of the world's most active online community of artists, and are general enough to be used by other teams at Wix.
  • Work closely with Machine Learning Platform Engineers to ensure your algorithms can be reliably deployed and operated in production at scale.
  • Leverage the expertise and infrastructure of other Wix machine learning teams to collaboratively build end-to-end systems, going from data ingestion all the way to serving results in production.
  • Stay up-to-date with developments in the machine learning research community and translate them into actionable suggestions for DeviantArt’s systems and goals.
  • Help maintain, redesign and migrate existing machine learning systems on the path to new paradigms and environments.
  • Travel occasionally to other locations in the US and/or Israel.

  • Seniority level

    Entry level

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    EngineeringInformation Technology

  • Industries

    InternetComputer Software
]

title: Market Data Analyst
description: [  The Opportunity  ZE is a global leader in the development of enterprise data management and analysis software. We design and develop ZEMA, a sophisticated suite of products that provide clients with powerful capabilities for data collection, process automation, and business intelligence through web based analytical tools, services, and dashboards.  Key Responsibilities   Cultivate relationships with new Data Vendors. Develop and strengthen existing relationships with Data Vendors. Be the voice and identity of ZE to our Vendors representing ZE and its client.  Respond to incoming interdepartmental and client request for Vendor assistance in a timely and professional manner.  Actively maintain a knowledge base of support contact information for all Data Vendors.  Publish client usage report and ensure client's compliance with vendor T&C.  Maintain credential management systems to control clients’ access to collect data and perform regular compliance audit.  Monitor email queues for incoming Market notices; identify business relevant notice and triage them to the correct technical team.  Keep ZE Clients informed about any market changes that may impact their business-critical processes.  Perform project coordination for incoming projects to the team, w.r.t new data report development, major source changes, onboarding clients and other projects.  Update the Processor Portal on a weekly basis   Requirements   Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related field  Exposure of knowledge in different categories of Market Data in the commodity industry: real-time data, exchange and broker data, reference data, pricing, trading platforms  2 years of ongoing related experience  Ability to write and understand SQL   About Us  ZE PowerGroup Inc. (ZE) is a global leader in the development of data management, analysis, and business automation software. ZEMA is our enterprise-level suite of products. ZEMA enables users to capture, transform, manipulate, analyze, report and visualize data quickly and easily. We work with world-class companies in energy, commodities, and finance to serve users in trade, risk management and IT. Our head office is in Vancouver, BC, and we have operations in Houston, Raleigh, London, Singapore, and Madrid. With a dynamic corporate culture and supportive management team, a career at ZE is what you make of it. Our environment is defined by the people that work in our company. We stress a balanced approach to work and healthy living. We have a games area as well as onsite Yoga. Our head office is located conveniently next to the Richmond Middle Arm waterfront trail, Olympic Oval, and Steve Nash Fitness club. ZE offers excellent career development opportunities along with a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are the kind of person who takes initiative, has a positive attitude, and wants to make an impact, then we want to hear from you.  Seniority level Associate  Employment type Full-time  Job function Information Technology  Industries Information Technology and Services Computer Software Financial Services  ]
description_raw:
[
The Opportunity

ZE is a global leader in the development of enterprise data management and analysis software. We design and develop ZEMA, a sophisticated suite of products that provide clients with powerful capabilities for data collection, process automation, and business intelligence through web based analytical tools, services, and dashboards.

Key Responsibilities
  • Cultivate relationships with new Data Vendors. Develop and strengthen existing relationships with Data Vendors. Be the voice and identity of ZE to our Vendors representing ZE and its client.
  • Respond to incoming interdepartmental and client request for Vendor assistance in a timely and professional manner.
  • Actively maintain a knowledge base of support contact information for all Data Vendors.
  • Publish client usage report and ensure client's compliance with vendor T&C.
  • Maintain credential management systems to control clients’ access to collect data and perform regular compliance audit.
  • Monitor email queues for incoming Market notices; identify business relevant notice and triage them to the correct technical team.
  • Keep ZE Clients informed about any market changes that may impact their business-critical processes.
  • Perform project coordination for incoming projects to the team, w.r.t new data report development, major source changes, onboarding clients and other projects.
  • Update the Processor Portal on a weekly basis
Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related field
  • Exposure of knowledge in different categories of Market Data in the commodity industry: real-time data, exchange and broker data, reference data, pricing, trading platforms
  • 2 years of ongoing related experience
  • Ability to write and understand SQL
About Us

ZE PowerGroup Inc. (ZE) is a global leader in the development of data management, analysis, and business automation software. ZEMA is our enterprise-level suite of products. ZEMA enables users to capture, transform, manipulate, analyze, report and visualize data quickly and easily. We work with world-class companies in energy, commodities, and finance to serve users in trade, risk management and IT. Our head office is in Vancouver, BC, and we have operations in Houston, Raleigh, London, Singapore, and Madrid.

With a dynamic corporate culture and supportive management team, a career at ZE is what you make of it. Our environment is defined by the people that work in our company. We stress a balanced approach to work and healthy living. We have a games area as well as onsite Yoga. Our head office is located conveniently next to the Richmond Middle Arm waterfront trail, Olympic Oval, and Steve Nash Fitness club. ZE offers excellent career development opportunities along with a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are the kind of person who takes initiative, has a positive attitude, and wants to make an impact, then we want to hear from you.

  • Seniority level

    Associate

  • Employment type

    Full-time

  • Job function

    Information Technology

  • Industries

    Information Technology and ServicesComputer SoftwareFinancial Services
]

Our head office is located conveniently next to the Richmond Middle Arm waterfront trail, Olympic Oval, and Steve Nash Fitness club. ZE offers excellent career development opportunities along with a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are the kind of person who takes initiative, has a positive attitude, and wants to make an impact, then we want to hear from you.

title: Associate Scientist, Analytical
description: [ Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates. Zymeworks is seeking a highly-motivated professional who is looking to grow their career with our company.  About The Position  We are currently seeking an Associate Scientist with a specialization in Analytical Chemistry. The analytical team applies mass spectrometry, liquid chromatography, capillary electrophoresis and other modern physicochemical characterization techniques to investigate the integrity, purity, stability and identity of proteins and bioconjugates. In addition, the team is responsible for the quantitation of protein and small molecule analytes from diverse biological matrices. The successful candidate will be part of a highly motivated multidisciplinary group responsible for supporting pipeline program advancement, ensuring rigorous quality control standards, and contributing to core platform technology improvements. The Associate Scientist will have a background in the protein sciences field and generate high quality data using advanced analytical techniques. Knowledge of antibody structure and function is preferred. Effective communication and discussion of data with team members and other groups will be a critical component of daily activities. A keen ability to quickly learn new techniques and technologies is also important. The position will involve a significant amount of time in the laboratory. An enthusiasm for teamwork is required. The Associate Scientist will be based in Vancouver, BC and report to the Principal Scientist, Conjugation Chemistry.  Key Responsibilities    Develops, optimizes and documents MS, HPLC, CE, and other analytical methods to support physicochemical characterization of proteins and bioconjugates.   Performs recovery and quantitative analyses of analytes from diverse biological matrices (in vitro and ex vivo).   Performs QC of reagents, proteins and bioconjugates.   Determines stability of small molecule, protein and bioconjugate formulations under conditions of storage and forced degradation.   Maintains advanced analytical instrumentation as required.   Enhances throughput of analytical workflows while maintaining rigorous data quality standards.   Carries out complex, well-controlled experiments using advanced techniques.   Applies strength in statistical analysis to experimental design and data interpretation.   Thoroughly documents experiments and data in lab book, reports and presentations.   Uses scientific methods and principles to design, implement and execute experiments in collaboration with a larger research team, while frequently making individual contributions.   Actively seeks to understand ongoing projects through attention to appropriate data and literature sources and employs this understanding to improve contributions to project goals.   Establishes and maintains effective and collaborative working relationships with fellow employees and management.   Effectively forecasts timelines and meets deadlines.    Qualifications And Experience    A PhD in a relevant scientific discipline such as biochemistry, chemistry or analytical chemistry and a minimum of 1 to 2 years’ related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience are required   Hands on experience in mass spectrometry analysis of proteins and peptides   Familiarity with analytical methods including LC-MS, cIEF, CE-SDS, HPLC, (RP-, HIC-, SEC-, HILIC-, IEX-) and peptide mapping   Experience with troubleshooting and collaborative resolution of complex problems under defined time constraints    Why Work for Us?  Zymeworks’ employees are passionate, engaged and extremely motivated to succeed. We are excited by the cutting-edge science and technology, the endless possibilities this union holds and the sheer opportunity to be a part of something big. To learn more about Zymeworks Inc. and our current openings, please visit our website at www.zymeworks.com. We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.  NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: Zymeworks values our relationships with our Recruitment Partners.
